results.title: Fearless: stories from Asian women
results.creator_credit: Peter Du Cane, Matthew Kelley, Samantha Kelley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This documentary examines the experiences of four women fighting for social justice. Each is from a different culture but they are united by a refusal to remain silent and by their pursuit of human rights justice. Explosive devices tells the story of Doris Nuval, a former terrorist who is utilizing the power of television to bring justice to the Philippines. The Price of freedom outlays Bangladeshi writer Taslima Nasrins struggle against womens oppression and the forces of fundamentalism. Breaking the caste investigates Fathima Burnards aim to empower the Dalait women of India, thus changing a 3000 year old caste system. Heart on the sleeve Hien Tran is the voice for thousands of Australian outworkers who work for a pittance, under exploitative circumstances.

results.title: Fearless vampire killers or pardon me but your teeth are in my neck
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Gene Gutowski and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A mixture of parody, horror film and fairytale, this film about a kindly old fanatic and his incompetent young assistant who take on a castle of thirsty vampires armed only with cowardice, stupidity and a sharp stake, was described by Polanski as “a cartoon with people”. Although his film is at core voyeuristically heterosexual, Polanski makes the homoerotic aspect of the vampire film explicit. The high point is the macabrely beautiful great vampire ball. Cast includes Jack MacGowran, Sharon Tate, Alfie Bass, Ferdy Mayne, Terry Downes, Fiona Lewis, Iain Quarrier and Jessie Robbins.

results.title: Fearless
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Mark Rosenberg, Paula Weinstein and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Rafael Yglesias, Peter Weir’s “Fearless” is a moving examination of the effects of surviving an airline crash. Max Klein (Jeff Bridges) is a successful San Fransiscan architect with a strong fear of flying. When he survives an airline crash his life changes completely. He believes he is invincible - he becomes fearless. Max emerges as the hero of the crash when he helps people out of the wrecked plane, but afterwards he becomes estranged from his wife (Isabella Rossellini) and son. Despite attempts by airline psychologist Bill Pearlman (John Turturro) to get Max to participate in his group therapy sessions, Max is happy to defy fate at every turn. The only person he can share his experiences with is Carla Rodrigo (Rosie Perez) who lost her young son in the crash. Max tries to ‘save’ Carla, who has lost the will to live, but who can save Max from his need to test the limits of his existence? A remarkable and riveting film with an excellent cast. The scenes of the planecrash are eerily realistic - don’t watch this before flying!

results.title: Feverhouse
results.brief_description: Old and out of time, the monstrous architecture of the institution forms a world endlessly growing into corridors, courtyards, fire escapes, places of worship and discipline. Moving freely through the building, manipulating his puppets, is an unfeeling and intimidating force - thief who preys upon the inhabitants. The inmates and their world are completely inseparable. One inhabitant is a nurse, numbed and repressed by a place which, she knows, touches and disfigures everything it contains. She becomes obsessed with one of the inmates, a lost and blind archivist, impotent amongst his nightmare relics from ancient dead cultures. In a desperate attempt to form some perfect bond with him, she uses the thief as a go-between to lure him into a secret tryst.

results.title: Feux follets
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Labrecque, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Les Feux Follets (Will-‘o-the-Wisps) was founded as an amateur dance group in Montreal and developed into a professional group whose repertoire represents the folklore and the ethnic origins of the Canadian people. Two dances illustrate the group’s virtuosity - a Plains Indian Betrothal dance, and a more frenetic exhibition of the sixties “go-go” dancing. Choreographed by Michel Cartier; music Claude Poirier; sound by Ron Alexander, Roger Lamoureux, Bernie Bordeleau and photographed and edited by Jean-Claude Labrecque.

results.title: Fetishes, Heidi Fleiss, Chicken Ranch - The Nick Broomfield collection volume 1: adventures in the sex trade
results.brief_description: Three works spotlighting the sex industry in America, by notorious documentary filmmaker, Nick Broomfield. “Heidi Fleiss” is about the infamous prostitute whose clientele included many top Hollywood players. Includes interviews with Fleiss, her colleagues and friends about the proceedings that led to her court case. “Chicken Ranch” is the name of the best-known legalised brothel in America; this piece observes the day-to-day lives of the women who work there. “Fetishes” explores the functions of the S&M parlor ‘Pandoras Box’ and various aspects of S&M, corporal punishment, whipping/slapping, wrestling fetish, rubber fetish, infantilism, slaves, humiliation, mistresses etc. Includes vivid footage of the parlor in operation. Broomfield’s tendency to centre himself within the subject under investigaion is borne out in these works that, depsite this irritation, address compelling aspects of prostitutiuon.

results.title: Father Christmas
results.creator_credit: Dave Unwin, John Coates and Blooming Productions
results.brief_description: In this charming animation based on the book by Raymond Briggs, Father Christmas decides to take a well-earned break after delivering all his presents on Christmas Eve. From France to Scotland to Las Vegas we follow the man in the red suit as he tries to relax and enjoy himself. However, this is not always easy or even possible for the busiest man in the world. A gentle parody of the English abroad, this film is a companion piece to ‘The Snowman’, another Christmas animation based on a Raymond Briggs story.

results.title: Festivals in Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Yu Ping Chung, David J.C. Shih, Weng Jeng-Yih and Goang Jiann Enterprises Corporation
results.brief_description: Chinese traditions, customs and festivals centre around the lunar calendar. In Taiwan, these customs and festivals take the form of a unique culture of temple fairs, each with their own local emphasis.

results.title: Father and daughter
results.brief_description: The poignant story of one girl’s life-long wait for her lost father. Simple brush animation takes us through a journey of time and memory in which a long for reconciliation magically occurs. Academy Award winner for Best Animation Short in 2001.

results.title: Father
results.creator_credit: John Power, Damien Parer, Leftbank Productions and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Internationally renowned Max von Sydow heads a cast of acclaimed actors, including Carol Drinkwater, Julia Blake and Steve Jacobs, in this powerfully moving film. It tells the story of a family whose lives are shattered when their elderly father is accused of being a Nazi war criminal. Torn between family love and loyalty and the devastating realities of wartime Nazi Germany, all relationships are tested to the limit. Photography by Dan Burstall. AFI Awards were won by Max von Sydow and Julia Blake.
